In the user manual section 6.1.2 CrawlScope it says:

PathScope

This scope goes yet further and limits the discovered URIs to a section of 
paths on hosts defined by the seeds. Of course any host that has a seed 
pointing at it's root (i.e. www.sample.com/index.html) will be included in 
full where as a host whose only seed is www.sample2.com/path/index.html 
will be limited to URIs under /path/.

It might be worthwhile to add something like

Note: internally Heritrix defines everything up to the right most slash as 
the path.  This may not always do what the user expects.  For example, the 
URLs members.aol.com/bigbird and members.aol.com/~bigbird will put any URL 
that starts with members.aol.com into focus.  To prevent this, use a form 
like members.aol.com/bigbird/ or members.aol.com/bigbird/index.html instead.
